attributes.comment:
My comments will reference the following item:

Document ID USCIS-2006-0044-0001
Long Title Adjustment of the Immigration Benefit Application/ Petition and
Biometric Fee Schedule

I am writing today to voice my opposition to the proposed increase in fees for the I-
600/A and I-171H forms. My wife and I are currently in the process of adopting a
child from China. We have already had to pay these fees once so far in the
process and could have to pay them another 1-2 times depending on how long the
process takes to be finalized. Wouldn't it make more sense to increase the I-
171H validity to 30-36 months so that we (adopting parents) wouldn't have
bombard your agency with new requests?
I believe that the government should be aiding us to bring our children home rather
than becoming another hinderance in the long road to adoption. We already face
so many hurdles when it comes to adoption, why would you want to throw another
emotional and financial one for us to get past?

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By James M Prestenberg
